createUserHelp:
You can do this by creating a Windows user, or creating a 'login' and 'user' within your SQL Server Management Studio, depending on your SQL Server set-up.

To do this with a Windows user:

1. Go into Windows/Settings/Accounts and create a new user called 'MEDIMAGE'. Bring up your Management Studio and connect to the database (typically with your original user)

2. Enter Database/Security/Login. Right click/Properties on the MEDIMAGE user. Click 'User Mapping' and tick your MedTech Evolution system. Assign db_datareader and db_datawriter permission for that user.

3. Click the 'Switch to MEDIMAGE user' button below.
createUserHelpFull:
You can do this manually in your SQL Server Management Studio or by creating a new Windows user called 'MEDIMAGE'. After a successful connection using the system user, above, you will be given an option to switch to the MEDIMAGE user (which will attempt to give permissions to that user, also).

To create this user manually:

1. Bring up your SQL Server Management Studio and connect to your SQL database (typically with the system login and password)

2. Create a 'login' on the whole system (under security properties) called 'MEDIMAGE', and then on your Evolution database properties, create a 'user' with the same name.

3. Grant db_datareader and db_datawriter permissions to the 'MEDIMAGE' user. You can run similar SQL queries to the following:

CREATE USER "YourServer\MEDIMAGE"; GRANT INSERT ON ATTACHMENTSMGR TO "YourServer\MEDIMAGE"; GRANT SELECT ON PATIENT TO "YourServer\MEDIMAGE" ;

4. Set the username to 'MEDIMAGE' in these settings, above.
odbcUserHelp:
Connecting with ODBC

1. Enter 'ODBC sources 32-bit' or 'ODBC sources 64-bit' in your Windows Start bar, choose your EHR's database driver, and create a new 'System DSN' (not a 'User DSN').

FieldExample Values
Data Source Name (DSN)medtech32
Databaselocalhost:1234
Database Accountsysadmin
Passwordyourpass

2. Fill out the details above, and click 'Test Connection', or the equivalent in your driver.

3. Enter the 'DSN' name i.e. 'medtech-evolution' into the 'ODBC Database DSN name' field above. Click 'Save and Check Connection' below.
